meanings.definition: To perform a lobotomy on (a person)
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to lobotomize the patient to treat their severe mental illness.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon decided to lobotomize the patient to alleviate their symptoms.
meanings.sent3: After the operation to lobotomize him, he started to feel much better.
meanings.sent4: She felt like her brain was lobotomized after studying for hours.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a lobotomy can be quite disturbing, as it involves lobotomizing the brain.

meanings.definition: To severely reduce the mental or emotional capacity of (someone)
meanings.sent1: The traumatic event seemed to lobotomize his ability to trust others.
meanings.sent2: The constant stress at work can slowly lobotomize a person's creativity.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with organizing everything could lobotomize the fun out of any activity.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments online can lobotomize one's self-esteem if not managed well.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous routine of daily life can lobotomize the excitement out of living.
